codes.verbatim_quote: Ho già unzippato la cartella, avevo già Docker. Quickstart: per Windows questo, mentre per Linux e Mac devo eseguire da terminale il file start
codes.context: User successfully navigates installation instructions and executes startup script without difficulty

codes.verbatim_quote: bello, bello HERITRACE, mi piace molto questa nuova interfaccia
codes.context: First impression when viewing system homepage after successful installation

codes.verbatim_quote: questa colonnina qua in mezzo così striminzita, vabbè, probabilmente è una scelta. Forse avrei preferito che fosse un po' più responsive, che si allargasse diversamente
codes.context: Observing narrow central column layout during warm-up catalog exploration

codes.verbatim_quote: Catalog. Ok, qua mi aspetto di trovare effettivamente le 100 entità che mi erano state promesse
codes.context: User immediately identifies catalog as location to access preloaded bibliographic resources

codes.verbatim_quote: Un journal, 15 issues e 5 volumi. Fammi un attimo vedere quel che c'è dentro, come si configura questa faccenda
codes.context: Exploring journal entity to understand hierarchical structure of volumes and issues

codes.verbatim_quote: Bello, chiaro, carino il fatto che ci sono delle similar resources
codes.context: Appreciating clear presentation of entity information and similar resources feature

codes.verbatim_quote: Ah, e questa è la Time Machine. Ok. Mi sarei aspettata che si chiamasse Time Machine, ma sì, piccolezze. Retrace
codes.context: Warm-up: User explores Retrace menu item and expresses expectation it should be labeled 'Time Machine' instead of 'Retrace', indicating nomenclature mismatch with mental model

codes.verbatim_quote: Sort by title. Non c'è una possibilità di ricercarlo per nome? Forse mi sarebbe piaciuta questa cosa
codes.context: Task 1: Looking for search functionality to find specific journal article, only finding sort options

codes.verbatim_quote: Mi sposterò con un Ctrl F. Ok, perfetto
codes.context: Task 1: Using browser's native find function (Ctrl+F) as workaround for missing search functionality

codes.verbatim_quote: C'ho forse mezzo dubbio su quale sia il... Ci posso sparare dentro soltanto l'identifier a secco? Ah no, lui mi chiede
codes.context: Task 1: Initial uncertainty about identifier entry, then discovering system prompts for required information

codes.verbatim_quote: Lo trova, lo trova. Lo trova, quindi devo andare io a cambiare qualcosa?
codes.context: Task 1: System successfully locates Caroline Scagel via ORCID identifier lookup

codes.verbatim_quote: Come... Lo devo aggiungere io oppure... Fammi vedere come me lo mette, va? Nel dubbio
codes.context: Task 1: After ORCID lookup finds author, user unclear whether author was automatically added or requires confirmation

codes.verbatim_quote: Ah, non lo posso modificare. Beh, amo, ma in che senso?
codes.context: Task 1: Confusion about why auto-populated author fields cannot be edited after selection from lookup

codes.verbatim_quote: non mi piace che me lo faccia lui. Cioè sì, mi piace che me lo trovi, però mi sento di non avere il pieno controllo su quello che sto inserendo
codes.context: Task 1: User appreciates lookup functionality but feels loss of control when system auto-fills information

codes.verbatim_quote: Ora questo autore 4. Che c'è che non... Ma perché? No vabbè, sicuramente è colpa mia, però non...
codes.context: Task 1: Attempting to reorder Caroline Scagel as first author but unclear about interface feedback

codes.verbatim_quote: Non mi piaceva tanto il fatto che non me lo facesse vedere in preview quando l'ho spostato come primo autore inserendo la mano
codes.context: Task 1: After saving, expressing dissatisfaction that drag-and-drop reordering doesn't show real-time preview

codes.verbatim_quote: Lo vedo, bene, buono, buono, ci sta
codes.context: Task 1: Satisfaction after confirming Caroline Scagel successfully appears as first author

codes.verbatim_quote: Stesso nome, stesso cognome. Due uomini diversi. Ma assumo che sia la stessa persona
codes.context: Task 2: Identifying duplicate Richard Carew entities through similar resources notification

codes.verbatim_quote: Bene, facile, è facile, è sensato
codes.context: Task 2: Appreciating straightforward merge interface after completing duplicate author merges

codes.verbatim_quote: Time Machine. Ha! Ha! Solo quelle cancellate? Vabbè, io adesso mi aspetto che journal article lo riapro
codes.context: Task 3: When accessing Time Machine to restore previous version, user momentarily confuses it with Time Vault, asking 'Solo quelle cancellate?' (Only deleted ones?) - a feature of Time Vault, not Time Machine. This confusion likely stems from earlier nomenclature mismatch where user expected 'Time Vault' to be called 'Time Machine' during warm-up

codes.verbatim_quote: Vabbè, io adesso mi aspetto che journal article lo riapro. Time Machine. Ha! Questa! Questa!
codes.context: Task 3: Successfully locating time machine icon on journal article page and recognizing correct snapshot

codes.verbatim_quote: La restoro. La restoro e torno al tempo magico in cui Scagel non era parte dei nostri autori
codes.context: Task 3: Clearly understanding which snapshot to restore to remove Caroline Scagel addition

codes.verbatim_quote: Restoro e vado a verificare che lei effettivamente non è tra gli autori. Buono, andata
codes.context: Task 3: Confirming successful restoration by verifying Caroline Scagel no longer appears in author list

codes.verbatim_quote: Questa me l'aspetto semplice, forse per... Non lo so, forse me la sto sentendo un po' calda. Journal article. Quindi vado qua. No! Falso. Vado qua. New Record
codes.context: Task 4: Approaching new publication creation with confidence, self-correcting navigation to 'New Record'

codes.verbatim_quote: Tipo: journal article. Poi DOI. Ed è lui
codes.context: Task 4: Correctly selecting journal article resource type and entering DOI as primary identifier

codes.verbatim_quote: Secondo me lui me lo trova anche, giusto? Eh? Beh no, non me lo trova, forse perché c'è... Vabbè, non ci rimango male
codes.context: Task 4: ORCID lookup not finding Arcangelo Massari, user accepting limitation without frustration

codes.verbatim_quote: Arcangelo. Massari. Add identifier. Metto l'ORCID. ORCID. Literal value
codes.context: Task 4: Manually entering first author with ORCID identifier after lookup failure

codes.verbatim_quote: Publisher. Quindi aggiungo il publisher... Pages. Aggiungo le pagine... Publication date. Metto la data... Issue... Volume... Journal
codes.context: Task 4: Methodically entering all required metadata fields in sequence for new publication

codes.verbatim_quote: [Audio corrupted - behavior reconstructed from video]
codes.context: Task 4: After creating author entities with given name and family name but leaving optional 'name' field empty, discovered that authors displayed with no visible names due to system bug that prioritizes empty 'name' field over populated given/family name fields

codes.verbatim_quote: [Audio corrupted - behavior reconstructed from video]
codes.context: Task 4: User autonomously identified that the invisible author name issue was caused by incorrectly populated entity fields, without requiring external assistance or prompting

codes.verbatim_quote: [Audio corrupted - behavior reconstructed from video]
codes.context: Task 4: After diagnosing the empty name field problem, user decided to delete incorrectly created author entities and recreate them from scratch with proper field values

codes.verbatim_quote: [Audio corrupted - behavior reconstructed from video]
codes.context: Task 4: After recreating author entities correctly, user independently performed merge operation to consolidate duplicate author entities without prompting, demonstrating learned behavior from Task 2

codes.verbatim_quote: I felt confident in addressing the tasks, the support provided was effective
codes.context: Written reflection: User expresses general satisfaction with system effectiveness and personal confidence in completing assigned tasks

codes.verbatim_quote: Interface can be improved in the new entity creation section to make the main metadata fields more easy to find
codes.context: Written reflection: User identifies usability issue in entity creation interface where primary metadata fields are not easily discoverable

codes.verbatim_quote: Human supervised merge of entities based on the system's suggestion
codes.context: Written reflection: User identifies merge functionality as most useful feature, specifically appreciating the system's ability to suggest merges while keeping human in control
